definitions.definition: To hang loosely with the ability to swing .
examples: His feet are dangling in the water.

definitions.definition: The action of performing a move or deke with the puck in order to get past a defender or goalie; perhaps because of the resemblance to dangling the puck on a string.
examples: He dangled around three players and the goalie to score.

definitions.definition: To hang or trail something loosely.
examples: I like to sit on the edge and dangle my feet in the water.

definitions.definition: To put forth as a possibility.
Of a patient : to be positioned with the legs hanging over the edge of the bed .
To position (a patient) in this way.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To hang loosely with the ability to swing .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , slang , ice hockey , lacrosse ) The action of performing a move or deke with the puck in order to get past a defender or goalie; perhaps because of the resemblance to dangling the puck on a string.
( transitive ) To hang or trail something loosely.
( transitive , figurative , by extension ) To put forth as a possibility.
( intransitive , dated ) To trail or follow around.
( medicine , intransitive ) Of a patient : to be positioned with the legs hanging over the edge of the bed .
( medicine , transitive ) To position (a patient) in this way.
